DOC.brief_summary: This pilot trail aims to assess the effectiveness of ECA cream in the treatment of calcifying shoulder tendinitis in terms of: 1. Reduction or removal of shoulder calcifications 2. Functional improvements 3. Pain improvements 10 subjects will be assessed prior and 1 and 2 months post intervention onset. The intervention will consist in the application of the ECA cream in the affected shoulder twice a day during 1 month.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of ECA Cream on Calcifying Shoulder Tendinitis
DOC.criteria: patients >=18 years diagnosed of calcifying shoulder tendinitis diagnosed by a medical specialist (rehabilitation, orthopedic surgeon or rheumatologist) by xray with disease evolution of more than 3 months and less than 12 months that give their informed consent by writing Previous shoulder surgery patients Patients with shoulder affections treated with shockwaves or corticosteroid injections.
